result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Marathon County Victim Waiver of No Contact Bond Condition- C.G.

Pre-trial conference on August 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on September 9, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Jury Trial on October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:47 pm.

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears from MCJ and with Attorney Fontana and Cannon.
Date and time set for IA.  VRCW.

PLEA: NOT GUILTY.

COURT ORDERS: $500 signature bond -- CONDITIONS:
- No contact with victim(s): J.J.E. and C.L.G.  Contact can be made by phone/text.
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 
- Take medications as prescribed.
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
